title: The new Zombieland: Double Tap trailer is out and we can't wait
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

We have all been waiting 10 years for a sequel to Zombieland and the time has finally come.

The trailer of Zombieland: Double Tap has arrived and it looks as intense and hilarious as the first one.

Its red-band trailer mean it’s going to be filled with a lot of cursing and a lot of violence.

But then again, how do you kill zombies without freaking out and cursing?

A decade has passed, and they make sure to mention that on the trailer as we’ve all been begging for a new movie for years.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The four zombie apocalypse survivors – Tallahassee (Woody Harrelson), Columbus (Jesse Eisenberg), Wichita (Emma Stone) and Little Rock (Abigail Breslin) – return to their roles but they all look even younger than they did in the first film.

Does this happen when there’s an apocalypse?

We’re not too sure how they survived 10 whole years (Picture: Youtube/Sony)

Bill in the movie talking about the movie (Picture: Youtube/Sony)

What’s even better is the fact that the production is from the writers of Deadpool, so we know it’s going to be hilarious.

Don’t worry, Bill Murray is also reprising his cameo from the first film despite the fact that he died in it.

‘Given that Bill Murray was probably everyone’s favorite part of the first movie, we always wanted to have another cameo,’ says Ruben Fleischer, who directed both zombie comedies.

‘In classic Hollywood tradition, we figured out a way to reverse engineer Bill Murray into the movie.’

How is he in the movie if he died, you ask?

He’s in there for a scene in which he appears to be discussing his appearance in the first action-packed film.

Meta.

Zombieland: Doubletap premieres on Friday, 18 October in the UK and US.
